description: Chibi-style mini animation for the D4DJ media franchise.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

name.native: 笹子・ジェニファー・由香

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimi_sound) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimin_official/)

A voice actor and musician, notably the lead vocalist and guitarist of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Aimi had dreamed of becoming a singer ever since she was young. She initially only aspired to become a singer, but she became interested in voice acting after becoming familiar with the anime series Macross Frontier, where she was impressed at how the series was able to combine music and animation in its storytelling. 

In order to make her dream come true, she participated in various contests, such as the “Best of Singer Contest National Championship 2008”, which she made into the Finals but lost. She was one of 3rd ANIMAX Anison Grand Prix Finalists with Sayaka Sasaki in 2009, and was a winner of the Osaka block. On February 6th, 2010, she made it to the finals of the “Aim for Ellie! Milky Holmes Seiyuu Audition”, a seiyuu audition tour hosted by DWANGO Creative School, but lost the role to Mikoi Sasaki. However, she did make her debut as a seiyuu in the Milky Holmes anime.

Aimi was the guitarist of a girls' band in high school and self-taught, but quit playing after graduating. She picked it up back in 2014 and used it to perform during her THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! live performances as Julia. Aimi is the influence and where Kidani Takaaki, the president of Bushiroad, got his idea for the BanG Dream! franchise from - after seeing Aimi playing the guitar during THE IDOLM@STER M@STERS OF IDOL WORLD!! 2014. 

She used her full name for her voice actress career and Aimi (愛美) for her singer career, but she started to use the latter for both since December 2013.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Brünhilde - Azur Lane (VG)
- Mica - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Serval - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yan - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Cristallo - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kanon_Shizaki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kshizaki_official/)

Kanon is a voice actress from Tokyo. She made her debut in 2018 as the new voice for Rinko Shirokane and keyboardist in the band [Roselia](https://anilist.co/staff/153170/Roselia), replacing Satomi Akesaka, as part the BanG Dream! project. Kanon played the piano for 12 years prior to joining the project. 

She also has a talent for singing, with her vocal key ranging from E3 to G5, and her falsetto (whistle voice) key to be at E6. Her hobbies include watching movies and listening to music, and her skills include singing, playing the keyboard, classical ballet, and calligraphy. She also has a younger sister with whom she doesn't get along well with. 

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia, edited)

**Height:** 153cm

[Profile](https://hibiki-cast.jp/hibiki_f/nishio_yuka/) | [Website](http://haruca.info/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/240y_k) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/240y_k/)

Haruka Nishio, better known by her stage name Yuuka Nishio is a Japanese singer, voice actress and DJ from Kanagawa Prefecture who is affiliated with Hibiki. She was formerly active as a solo musician under the name Haruca, releasing the single "Eien no Kotae" in 2017. She is known for her roles as Nanami Hiromachi in BanG Dream!, where she also serves as the bassist of the band Morfonica, and as Rinku Aimoto, the protagonist of the multimedia franchise D4DJ.

__Height:__ 153cm

[Profile (Galaxy Pro)](https://galaxypro.amebaownd.com/pages/1953307/page_201805260907) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rihonyan103) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rihonyan103/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/加藤里保菜)

Rihona Katou is a half-Japanese half-Filipino idol, actress, and voice actress.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/risa_tsumugi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tsumurisa/) | [Agency Profile](https://hibiki-cast.jp/hibiki_f/tsumugi_risa/)

A voice actress from Okinawa, Japan. She is the DJ of the band [RAISE A SUILEN](https://anilist.co/staff/153132/). She is affiliated with HiBiKi. 

Risa went to an international school when she was younger, and as a result she is quite skilled in English. She is also proficient in speaking in the Okinawan dialect, as she was born in Okinawa. Risa began dreaming of becoming a voice actress after hearing Aya Hirano's voice acting. In 2017 Risa was scouted and became affiliated with HiBiKi through their rookie scouting. She then debuted with the role of Yuzuki "Hime" Yukimura in the 15th episode of Aikatsu Friends!. Risa's addition RAISE A SUILEN was announced during their second official live on July 17, 2018. On October 19, 2022, she announced her marriage with the composer [Yuuki Honda](https://anilist.co/staff/220707/Yuuki-Honda).

Risa's hobbies include traveling around different shrines and temples, doing illustrations, and collecting temple seals. She is also quite skilled at tennis. Her favorite foods are cheese, jerky, and prosciutto. She often adds English words in her speech and is very energetic.

[Profile (One Eight)](http://www.18pro.co.jp/profile/archives/7) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hirajima-official/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nacchan_h0528) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/natsuminsta528/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCCqGTaiiO4V-ZvbpvV4ieQ/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natsumi_Hirajima) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/平嶋夏海)

Natsumi Hirajima is a Japanese tarento, actress, and gravure idol. She is a former member of the Japanese idol girl group AKB48. She joined Team A in 2005, and transferred to Team B in 2007, where she stayed until her graduation on February 5, 2012.

Bushiroad Inc. (株式会社ブシロード, Kabushiki-gaisha Bushirōdo) is a Japanese entertainment company producer of collectible card games and trading cards, publisher of mobile apps and games, promotional items and many other venues, which was founded in 2007 by Takaaki Kidani and is headquartered in Tokyo.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bushi_PR)
